title: A new Trader Joe’s is set to open in Boston this week
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News Boston’s newest Trader Joe’s location in West Roxbury is gearing up to open this Thursday.
The Trader Joe’s store in Hadley.
Jonathan Wiggs / The Boston Globe By Sana Muneer October 28, 2025 | 5:08 PM 1 minute to read Boston’s newest Trader Joe’s location in West Roxbury is gearing up to open this Thursday, the store said.

title: How love is at the heart of the scariest horror films
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Love Letters Akela Cooper, the screenwriter behind "American Horror Story," joins the latest Love Letters episode to talk about the horror of vulnerability — and opening yourself up to love.
Akela Cooper attends the Los Angeles Premiere Of Universal Pictures' "M3GAN" at TCL Chinese Theatre on December 07, 2022 in Hollywood, California.

title: Award-winning steakhouse Boston Chops is up for sale
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Food News Restaurateur Brian Piccini says he’s shifting his focus from Boston Chops to a new nature-inspired restaurant in Weston.
8 oz Choice Filet Mignon at Boston Chops.
Andy Ryan Boston restaurateur Brian Piccini announced Tuesday that his acclaimed steakhouse Boston Chops is for sale.

title: Ex-Stoughton officer now charged with death of Sandra Birchmore’s unborn baby
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Crime Matthew Farwell allegedly groomed Birchmore and killed her after learning that she was pregnant in 2021.
The former Stoughton police detective accused of killing 23-year-old Sandra Birchmore while she was pregnant now faces an additional charge.
Matthew Farwell.

title: Review & setlist: Like clockwork, Boston fell in love with Laufey at TD Garden

title: Patriots sign CB Marcus Jones to contract extension
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Patriots Jones was originally a third-round pick in 2022.
Marcus Jones at Patriots practice in October.

title: Only one Papa Gino’s remains in Boston after Hyde Park location closes
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food News The Hyde Park location closed over the weekend.
Another Papa Gino's has closed, leaving only one location left in Boston proper.
(AP Photo/Bill Sikes) A Papa Gino’s pizzeria shuttered in Hyde Park over the weekend, leaving only one location of the Massachusetts chain left in Boston proper.
